moves.1. d4: d4. Staking claim to the center, while prompting a positional game.
moves.1... d5 2. e4 e5 3. c4 g6: He obliges to a drawn-out siege war by sacrificing his d5 pawn and preparing to fianchetto.
moves.6. Qxh8 Qa5+: Now, with my Queen in the corner, he strikes.
moves.7. Bd2 Qa4 8. b3: Weak. Nc3 is much stronger. As is Qe5+.
moves.8... Qxe4+ 9. Be2: ?? This hangs the Rook and Pawn.
moves.16. Qxa7:
I equalize. Now begins the wonderful ballad of the a8 corner.

*OPENING*
moves.23... Rb7 24. Qa6 g4: Pushing on the Kingside, opposite of the battle.
moves.25. Na3 Nc6 26. Nc4 Nb8:
Now that he attacks my Queen, I launch counterattacks, and, now that all the pieces (excluding pawns and Kings) are (1) at the corner, (1) aimed at the corner, or (3) soon to be either 1 or 2, the ballad resumes in ernest. 

*CANTO I*
moves.34... Ncd5 35. Nce6+: I do not remember what I was thinking here.
Or here. Possible seeing what appears to be a fork (though a useless one) on c6.
moves.60... Nd6 61. a5 Nb7 62. a6 Kb8: Here, he appears to give up.
What a Game! Thank you for reading! Please rate and comment.

gameName: The Ballad of the A8 Corner
